code: @Manual{,   title = {shrthnd: Work with data that uses shorthand and symbols},   author = {Matt Kerlogue},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/mattkerlogue/shrthnd, https://mattkerlogue.github.io/shrthnd/}, }

what: Work with data that uses shorthand and symbols
title: Work with data that uses shorthand and symbols
text: Data often published shorthand symbols, regularly tags found container value. aim shrthnd process character vectors numerical data contain non-numeric shorthand symbols. common approach data processing scrub vector non-numeric characters can coerced numeric vector. However, tags often convey useful information may wish retain. shrthnd_num() data type allows separate components, use numeric component desired

title: Work with data that uses shorthand and symbols
text: can install development version shrthnd like :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("mattkerlogue/shrthnd")

title: Work with data that uses shorthand and symbols
text: Use shrthnd_num() convert character vector shrthnd_num vector, either shrthnd_integer shrthnd_double based properties underlying numerical content. vctrs::vec_rcrd() data type splits numeric content non-numeric tags original character vector keeps together rather discards .

title: Work with data that uses shorthand and symbols
text: shrthnd logo combination word “shorthand” written Pitman shorthand asterisk.

text: as_shrthnd() coerces shrthnd_num() vector back character vector re-inserting shorthand tags.

code: as_shrthnd(x, digits = NULL, .pillar = FALSE, ...)

title: Coerce a shrthnd_num to a character vector with shorthand — as_shrthnd
text: x shrthnd_num() vector digits Number digits apply shrthnd_double vectors .pillar flag formatting within {pillar} package ... Arguments pass formatC()

title: Coerce a shrthnd_num to a character vector with shorthand — as_shrthnd
text: character vector

title: Coerce a shrthnd_num to a character vector with shorthand — as_shrthnd
text: calling .character() shrthnd_num() output expect calling traditional numeric vector, as_shrthnd() returns character vector combining numeric vector shorthand tags. digits = NULL shrthnd_double vectors printed number digits set digits attribute vector, setting digits as_shrthnd() override value.

title: Coerce a shrthnd_num to a character vector with shorthand — as_shrthnd

what: Test if an object is using shrthnd — is_shrthnd_num
title: Test if an object is using shrthnd — is_shrthnd_num
text: is_shrthnd_* family functions test whether vector either shrthnd_num(), shrthnd_list(). is_shrthnd_integer() is_shrthnd_double() test whether object shrthnd_num() vector whether underlying data type integer() double(). is_shrthnd_tbl() test whether object shrthnd_tbl() tibble.

title: Test if an object is using shrthnd — is_shrthnd_num
code: is_shrthnd_num(x)  is_shrthnd_integer(x)  is_shrthnd_double(x)  is_shrthnd_list(x)  is_shrthnd_tbl(x)

title: Test if an object is using shrthnd — is_shrthnd_num
text: x object tested

title: Test if an object is using shrthnd — is_shrthnd_num
text: logical vector

title: Test if an object is using shrthnd — is_shrthnd_num
code: x <- c("12", "34.567", "[c]", "NA", "56.78[e]", "78.9", "90.123[e]") sh_x <- shrthnd_num(x, c("[c]", "[e]")) is_shrthnd_num(sh_x) #> [1] TRUE is_shrthnd_double(sh_x) #> [1] TRUE  y <- c("12", "34", "[c]", "NA", "56[e]", "78", "90[e]") sh_y <- shrthnd_num(y, c("[c]", "[e]")) is_shrthnd_num(sh_y) #> [1] TRUE is_shrthnd_integer(sh_y) #> [1] TRUE  sh_l <- shrthnd_list(sh_x) is_shrthnd_list(sh_l) #> [1] TRUE  tbl <- tibble::tibble(x = x, sh_x = sh_x) sh_tbl <- shrthnd_tbl(tbl, title = "Example table") is_shrthnd_tbl(sh_tbl) #> [1] TRUE

what: Move notes to and from the title/source note of a tibble — note_to_title
title: Move notes to and from the title/source note of a tibble — note_to_title
text: shrthnd_tbl() three sets notes, note_to_*() functions allow move general note either title source note tibble. *_to_notes()functions opposite (re)insert either title /source note back general notes.

title: Move notes to and from the title/source note of a tibble — note_to_title
code: note_to_title(x, note, .overwrite = FALSE)  note_to_source_note(x, note, .overwrite = FALSE)  title_to_notes(x, .add_before = 0)  source_to_notes(x, .add_before = Inf)  title_source_to_notes(x, .add_before = 0)

title: Move notes to and from the title/source note of a tibble — note_to_title
text: x shrthnd_tbl() object note number note move .overwrite Whether overwrite existing .add_before (re)insert note

title: Move notes to and from the title/source note of a tibble — note_to_title
text: shrthnd_tbl()

title: Move notes to and from the title/source note of a tibble — note_to_title
text: title_to_notes() title_source_to_notes() default (re)insert note start set notes, source_to_notes() default (re)insert note end set notes.

title: Move notes to and from the title/source note of a tibble — note_to_title
code: x <- c("12", "34.567", "[c]", "NA", "56.78[e]", "78.9", "90.123[e]") sh_x <- shrthnd_num(x, c("[c]", "[e]")) tbl <- tibble::tibble(x = x, sh_x = sh_x)  sh_tbl <- shrthnd_tbl(tbl) |>   set_notes(c("Note 1", "Note 2", "Note 3")) |>   note_to_title(1) |>   note_to_source_note(2)  sh_tbl #> # Title:    Note 1 #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   x             sh_x #>   <chr>     <sh_dbl> #> 1 12           12.00 #> 2 34.567       34.57 #> 3 [c]            [c] #> 4 NA              NA #> 5 56.78[e]  56.78[e] #> 6 78.9         78.90 #> 7 90.123[e] 90.12[e] #> # ★ Source: Note 3 #> # ★ There is 1 note, use `shrthnd_notes(x)` to view  shrthnd_notes(sh_tbl) #> [1] "Note 2"  sh_tbl <- sh_tbl |>   title_to_notes()  shrthnd_notes(sh_tbl) #> [1] "Note 1" "Note 2"

what: List the shorthand in a vector — shrthnd_list
title: List the shorthand in a vector — shrthnd_list
text: shrthnd_list() generates lookup table shorthand markers vector, either character vector containing shorthand shrthnd_num() vector.

title: List the shorthand in a vector — shrthnd_list
code: shrthnd_list(   x,   shorthand = NULL,   na_values = c("", "NA"),   dec = ".",   bigmark = "," )

title: List the shorthand in a vector — shrthnd_list
text: x character vector containing shorthand, shrthnd_num() vector shorthand character vector shorthand values validate tags na_values character value NA values ignore dec decimal separator numbers bigmark separator left decimal separator

title: List the shorthand in a vector — shrthnd_list
text: list shorthand positions vector

title: List the shorthand in a vector — shrthnd_list
code: x <- c("12", "34.567", "[c]", "NA", "56.78[e]", "78.9", "90.123[e]") shrthnd_list(x) #> <shrthnd_list[2]>  #> [c] (1 location): 3  #> [e] (2 locations): 5, 7   sh_x <- shrthnd_num(x) sh_x #> <shrthnd_num[7]> #> [1] 12.00    34.57    [c]      <NA>     56.78[e] 78.90    90.12[e] shrthnd_list(sh_x) #> <shrthnd_list[2]>  #> [c] (1 location): 3  #> [e] (2 locations): 5, 7

title: Arithmetic and mathematical operations — shrthnd_maths
text: Arithmetic mathematical operations supported numeric component shrthnd_num() vectors via {vctrs} package without wrap vector .numeric().

title: Arithmetic and mathematical operations — shrthnd_maths
text: can use standard arithmetic infix operators (+, -, /, *, ^, %%, %/%, !). See vctrs::vec_arith() details. vctrs::vec_math() following generic mathematical operations supported: Summary group generic: prod(), sum(), (), (). Math group generic: abs(), sign(), sqrt(), ceiling(), floor(), trunc(), cummax(), cummin(), cumprod(), cumsum(), log(), log10(), log2(), log1p(), acos(), acosh(), asin(), asinh(), atan(), atanh(), exp(), expm1(), cos(), cosh(), cospi(), sin(), sinh(), sinpi(), tan(), tanh(), tanpi(), gamma(), lgamma(), digamma(), trigamma(). vectrs::vec_math() also enables support mean(), .nan(), .finite() .infinite(). addition , {shrthnd} package also provides methods median() quantile(), work sd() due ability shrthnd_num() easily coerced numeric vector. operations need wrap shrthnd_num vector .numeric(). operations remember likely need set na.rm = TRUE whatever method function ignoring missing values.

title: Arithmetic and mathematical operations — shrthnd_maths

what: Convert a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num
title: Convert a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num
text: shrthnd_num() coerces character vector containing numeric data values non-numeric tags numeric-like vector also retaining tags.

title: Convert a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num
code: shrthnd_num(   x,   shorthand = NULL,   na_values = "NA",   digits = 2L,   paren_nums = c("negative", "strip"),   dec = ".",   bigmark = "," )

title: Convert a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num
text: x character vector numeric values shorthand shorthand character vector shorthand values na_values character vector NA values digits number digits formatting numbers paren_nums handle numbers parenthesis (e.g. (12,435.43)), defaults negative commonly used accounting denote negative values instead minus symbol preceding value dec decimal separator numbers bigmark separator left decimal separator

title: Convert a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num
text: shrthnd_num vector

title: Convert a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num
text: Data stored documents publications regularly annotated shorthand symbols. Often tags found container (e.g. table spreadsheet cell) value associated , requires cleaning vector extract numeric values. simple approach discard non-numeric components, however tags can convey information may wish retain. shrthnd_num() provides data type can store numeric data marker. default shrthnd_num() extract non-numeric values following numeric ones process shorthand tag. However, can optionally supply vector tags, using shorthand argument, wish validate extracted tags accept vectors specific shorthand values. underlying numeric values real numbers (.e. double() vector) digits argument used format display shrthnd_dbl vector (defaults 2 decimal places).

title: Convert a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num

what: Get the tags attached to a shrthnd vector — shrthnd_tags
title: Get the tags attached to a shrthnd vector — shrthnd_tags
text: shrthnd_tags() provides character vector length x shorthand tags, NA value tag. shrthnd_unique_tags() convenience wrapper unique(shrthnd_tags(x)), can also called shrthnd_list() object.

title: Get the tags attached to a shrthnd vector — shrthnd_tags
code: shrthnd_tags(x)  shrthnd_unique_tags(x)

title: Get the tags attached to a shrthnd vector — shrthnd_tags
text: x shrthnd_num() vector

title: Get the tags attached to a shrthnd vector — shrthnd_tags
text: character vector

title: Get the tags attached to a shrthnd vector — shrthnd_tags
Add notes to tibbles — shrthnd_tbl
text: Add notes tibbles

title: Add notes to tibbles — shrthnd_tbl
code: shrthnd_tbl(tbl, title = NULL, notes = NULL, source_note = NULL)

title: Add notes to tibbles — shrthnd_tbl
text: tbl tibble::tibble() object can coerced tibble. title character vector representing title tbl notes character vector notes relating title source_note character vector source note

title: Add notes to tibbles — shrthnd_tbl
text: tibble shrthnd annotations

title: Add notes to tibbles — shrthnd_tbl
code: x <- c("12", "34.567", "[c]", "NA", "56.78[e]", "78.9", "90.123[e]") sh_x <- shrthnd_num(x, c("[c]", "[e]")) tbl <- tibble::tibble(x = x, sh_x = sh_x) shrthnd_tbl(   tbl,   title = "Example table",   notes = c("Note 1", "Note 2"),   source_note = "Shrthnd documentation, 2023" ) #> # Title:    Example table #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   x             sh_x #>   <chr>     <sh_dbl> #> 1 12           12.00 #> 2 34.567       34.57 #> 3 [c]            [c] #> 4 NA              NA #> 5 56.78[e]  56.78[e] #> 6 78.9         78.90 #> 7 90.123[e] 90.12[e] #> # ★ Source: Shrthnd documentation, 2023 #> # ★ There are 2 notes, use `shrthnd_notes(x)` to view

title: Get tag locations — tag_match
text: Base R's matching location functions work directly numeric component shrthnd_num() vector, functions provide functionality applied tag component.

title: Get tag locations — tag_match
code: tag_match(x, tag)  tag_in(x, tag)  where_tag(x, tag)  any_tag(x)  no_tag(x)  locate_tag(x, tag)  locate_any_tag(x)  locate_no_tag(x)

title: Get tag locations — tag_match
text: x shrthnd_num() vector tag single tag locate

title: Get tag locations — tag_match
text: tag_match(), locate_tag(), locate_any_tag() locate_no_tag() integer vector. tag_in(), where_tag(), any_tag() no_tag() logical vector.

title: Get tag locations — tag_match
text: tag_match() tag_in() wrappers around vctrs::vec_match() vctrs::vec_in() thus equivalent match() %% applied tag components shrthnd_num(). tag_match() return integer vector showing first location tag provided, tag_in() return TRUE FALSE depending whether tag vector's shorthand. where_tag() equivalent computing tags == tag, any_tag() equivalent .na(tags), no_tag() equivalent .na(tags). return logical vector length x. locate_tag(), locate_any_tag(), located_no_tag() equivalent passing return values where_tag(), any_tag() no_tag() (). return integer vector length x.

title: Get tag locations — tag_match
code: x <- c("12", "34.567", "[c]", "NA", "56.78[e]", "78.9", "90.123[e]") sh_x <- shrthnd_num(x, c("[c]", "[e]")) shrthnd_tags(sh_x) #> [1] NA    NA    "[c]" NA    "[e]" NA    "[e]"  tag_match(sh_x, "[e]") #> [1] 5  tag_in(sh_x, "[e]") #> [1] TRUE  where_tag(sh_x, "[e]") #> [1]    NA    NA FALSE    NA  TRUE    NA  TRUE  any_tag(sh_x) #> [1] FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE  no_tag(sh_x) #> [1]  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  locate_tag(sh_x, "[e]") #> [1] 5 7  locate_any_tag(sh_x) #> [1] 3 5 7  locate_no_tag(sh_x) #> [1] 1 2 4 6

what: Get and set notes for a tibble — tbl_notes
title: Get and set notes for a tibble — tbl_notes
text: shrthnd_tbl() three sets notes can defined: title, source_note set general notes. family functions allows set modify notes.

title: Get and set notes for a tibble — tbl_notes
code: shrthnd_title(x)  shrthnd_title(x) <- value  set_title(x, value, .overwrite = FALSE)  shrthnd_source_note(x)  shrthnd_source_note(x) <- value  set_source_note(x, value, .overwrite = FALSE)  shrthnd_notes(x)  shrthnd_notes(x) <- value  set_notes(x, value, .overwrite = FALSE)  add_notes(x, value, .add_before = Inf)  add_notes(x) <- value  set_tbl_attr(   x,   what = c("title", "source_note", "notes"),   value,   .overwrite = FALSE,   .add = FALSE,   .add_before = Inf )

title: Get and set notes for a tibble — tbl_notes
text: x shrthnd_tbl() object value value set .overwrite Whether existing value overwritten .add_before adding notes, add note (defaults end current set notes) note set, one title, source_note notes .add = "notes", whether append existing set notes

title: Get and set notes for a tibble — tbl_notes
text: shrthnd_title(), shrthnd_source_note() shrthnd_notes() character vector note(s). setting functions returns invisibly either x attribute set NULL .

title: Get and set notes for a tibble — tbl_notes
text: shrthnd_title(), shrthnd_source_note() shrthnd_notes() get relevant note(s) shrthnd_tbl() object. Passing value functions (shrthnd_title(x) <- "title") set value notes, overwriting existing value(s). set_title(), set_source_note(), set_notes() also allow set value notes. default permit overwriting existing values, setting .overwrite = TRUE permits . add_notes() allows append notes existing set general notes. set_tbl_attr() low level helper function powers assignment operations.

title: Get and set notes for a tibble — tbl_notes
code: x <- c("12", "34.567", "[c]", "NA", "56.78[e]", "78.9", "90.123[e]") sh_x <- shrthnd_num(x, c("[c]", "[e]")) tbl <- tibble::tibble(x = x, sh_x = sh_x)  sh_tbl <- shrthnd_tbl(tbl) |>   set_title("My Example Table") |>   set_source_note("Shrthnd Documentation, 2023") |>   set_notes(c("Note 1", "Note 2"))  sh_tbl #> # Title:    My Example Table #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   x             sh_x #>   <chr>     <sh_dbl> #> 1 12           12.00 #> 2 34.567       34.57 #> 3 [c]            [c] #> 4 NA              NA #> 5 56.78[e]  56.78[e] #> 6 78.9         78.90 #> 7 90.123[e] 90.12[e] #> # ★ Source: Shrthnd Documentation, 2023 #> # ★ There are 2 notes, use `shrthnd_notes(x)` to view  shrthnd_title(sh_tbl) #> [1] "My Example Table" shrthnd_source_note(sh_tbl) #> [1] "Shrthnd Documentation, 2023" shrthnd_notes(sh_tbl) #> [1] "Note 1" "Note 2"  add_notes(sh_tbl) <- "Note 3" shrthnd_notes(sh_tbl) #> [1] "Note 1" "Note 2" "Note 3"

what: Identify which columns use shrthnd — where_shrthnd_cols
title: Identify which columns use shrthnd — where_shrthnd_cols
text: where_shrthnd_cols() applies is_shrthnd_num() across columns data.frame (elements list). which_shrthnd_cols() identifies columns data.frame (elements list) name index position. any_shrthnd_cols() tests whether data.frame (list) columns shrthnd_num() vectors.

title: Identify which columns use shrthnd — where_shrthnd_cols
code: where_shrthnd_cols(x)  which_shrthnd_cols(x, .names = TRUE)  any_shrthnd_cols(x)

title: Identify which columns use shrthnd — where_shrthnd_cols
text: x data.frame (list) .names logical vector indicating whether return column names (default) integer vector column positions

title: Identify which columns use shrthnd — where_shrthnd_cols
text: where_shrthnd_cols() logical vector length number columns x. which_shrthnd_cols() character vector names (default) integer vector index positions columns (elements) shrthnd_num vectors. any_shrthnd_cols() either TRUE shrthnd_num() vectors object FALSE .

title: Identify which columns use shrthnd — where_shrthnd_cols
code: x <- c("12", "34.567", "[c]", "NA", "56.78[e]", "78.9", "90.123[e]") sh_x <- shrthnd_num(x, c("[c]", "[e]")) tbl <- tibble::tibble(x = x, sh_x = sh_x)  where_shrthnd_cols(tbl) #> [1] FALSE  TRUE  which_shrthnd_cols(tbl) #> [1] "sh_x"  which_shrthnd_cols(tbl, .names = FALSE) #> [1] 2  any_shrthnd_cols(tbl) #> [1] TRUE

title: Remove notes from tibbles — zap_shrthnd
text: zap_*() functions remove notes shrthnd_tbl() object. zap_title(), zap_source_note() zap_notes() remove title, source note general notes respectively. zap_tbl() removes three types notes also strips shrthnd_tbl class object. zap_shrthnd() low-level helper function power attribute removal.

title: Remove notes from tibbles — zap_shrthnd
code: zap_title(x)  zap_source_note(x)  zap_notes(x)  zap_tbl(x)  zap_shrthnd(x, what = c("title", "source_note", "notes"), zap_class = FALSE)

title: Remove notes from tibbles — zap_shrthnd
text: x shrthnd_tbl() One title, source_note notes indicating set notes remove zap_class Whether remove "shrthnd_tbl" class

title: Remove notes from tibbles — zap_shrthnd
text: Returns x relevant attributes removed

title: Remove notes from tibbles — zap_shrthnd
text: remove shrthnd vector use .numeric(), .character() as_shrthnd() coerce vector another type.

title: Remove notes from tibbles — zap_shrthnd
code: x <- c("12", "34.567", "[c]", "NA", "56.78[e]", "78.9", "90.123[e]") sh_x <- shrthnd_num(x, c("[c]", "[e]")) tbl <- tibble::tibble(x = x, sh_x = sh_x) sh_tbl <- shrthnd_tbl(   tbl,   title = "Example table",   notes = c("Note 1", "Note 2"),   source_note = "Shrthnd documentation, 2023" )  sh_tbl #> # Title:    Example table #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   x             sh_x #>   <chr>     <sh_dbl> #> 1 12           12.00 #> 2 34.567       34.57 #> 3 [c]            [c] #> 4 NA              NA #> 5 56.78[e]  56.78[e] #> 6 78.9         78.90 #> 7 90.123[e] 90.12[e] #> # ★ Source: Shrthnd documentation, 2023 #> # ★ There are 2 notes, use `shrthnd_notes(x)` to view  zap_title(sh_tbl) #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   x             sh_x #>   <chr>     <sh_dbl> #> 1 12           12.00 #> 2 34.567       34.57 #> 3 [c]            [c] #> 4 NA              NA #> 5 56.78[e]  56.78[e] #> 6 78.9         78.90 #> 7 90.123[e] 90.12[e] #> # ★ Source: Shrthnd documentation, 2023 #> # ★ There are 2 notes, use `shrthnd_notes(x)` to view  zap_source_note(sh_tbl) #> # Title:    Example table #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   x             sh_x #>   <chr>     <sh_dbl> #> 1 12           12.00 #> 2 34.567       34.57 #> 3 [c]            [c] #> 4 NA              NA #> 5 56.78[e]  56.78[e] #> 6 78.9         78.90 #> 7 90.123[e] 90.12[e] #> # ★ There are 2 notes, use `shrthnd_notes(x)` to view  zap_notes(sh_tbl) #> # Title:    Example table #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   x             sh_x #>   <chr>     <sh_dbl> #> 1 12           12.00 #> 2 34.567       34.57 #> 3 [c]            [c] #> 4 NA              NA #> 5 56.78[e]  56.78[e] #> 6 78.9         78.90 #> 7 90.123[e] 90.12[e] #> # ★ Source: Shrthnd documentation, 2023  zap_tbl(sh_tbl) #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   x             sh_x #>   <chr>     <sh_dbl> #> 1 12           12.00 #> 2 34.567       34.57 #> 3 [c]            [c] #> 4 NA              NA #> 5 56.78[e]  56.78[e] #> 6 78.9         78.90 #> 7 90.123[e] 90.12[e]

title: shrthnd 0.1.0
text: shrthnd package exists Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
